result.execSummary:
The defendant Brady D. Steinke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
No credit if revoked. 
Case 21CF184 is dismissed and read in.

miscConds.notes: Amount to be determined within 60 days.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete a Domestic Abuse assessment and follow through with recommendations. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide a DNA sample.

No contact with: A.S. or T.S. with out the probation agent's and their written approval. No contact with B.L. or his residence. No Contact with P.L., K.B., S.W., F.M. or any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brady D. Steinke

defendant.name: Steinke, Brady D.
defendant.address: 5702 Otter Creek Ct # 6, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek post conviction relief

3:26 PM cases 20CF1427, 20CF1572, 20CM913, 21CF1394, 22CF44, 20CM1213, 21CF184, 21CF600 called. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brady D. Steinke in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Brady D. Steinke. There is an agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 20CF1427: Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Information. 
In 20CF1572:  Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3 as charged in the Information. 
In 20CM913:  Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Criminal Complaint. 
In 21CF1394:  Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 3, 5 and 8 as charged in the Information. 
In 22CF44:  Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
In 20CM1213:  Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Criminal Complaint. 
In 21CF600:  Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 4 and 5 as charged in the Information. 
Defendant acknowledges prior OWI conviction to support finding of Guilt in an OWI 2nd. 
Court has colloquy with defendant regarding No Contest pleas. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant Guilty.  
Anything else is dismissed and read in. Court addresses defendant before sentencing. 
As to Count 5 in 20CF1394: Court orders court costs only. 

As to Count 5 in 21CF600: Defendant to serve 10 days in jail with Huber. Defendant has 60 days to report. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. Pay $1,429 (fine + costs) and the Sacred Heart blood draw fee. 
Defendant's driver's license is revoked for 12 months and defendant to install an IID for 12 months after license is reinstated. 
Court finds defendant is eligible for 1/2 priced IID. 

As to all other counts to which the defendant was found guilty: Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete a Domestic Abuse assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay restitution in an amount TBD within 60 days. 
No contact with:  A.S. or  T.S. with out the probation agent's and their written approval. 
No contact with B.L. or his residence. 
No Contact with P.L., K.B., S.W., F.M. or any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to pay court costs including one bench warrant fee in 20CF1427. 
As to Count 2 in 20CF1427 only: 120 days in jail with Huber all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
In 20CF1427 defendant has 3 days sentence credit. In 20CF1572 5 days credit. In 20CM913 5 days credit. 
In all other cases, there is no sentence credit. All sentence credit is to be applied if defendant is revoked from probation.
Status conference on April 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:23 AM Cases called: 21CF1394, 22CF44, 20CM1213, 21CF184, 21CF600, 20CF1427, 20CF1572 & 20CM913. Defendant Brady D. Steinke not in court, Attorney Alicia Linzmeier for Brady D. Steinke appeared in court, Attorney Loralee Clark for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Attorney Linzmeier spoke with her client yesterday and is unsure why he does not appear today. There is not an agreement at this time. STC: 04/20/22 at 3pm in all cases.

RECALLED: Appearances are the same. Defendant appears now. 
21CF1394 & 22CF44: Not guilty pleas entered and accepted by the Court. 20 days to file motions which can be extended for good cause. 
STC previously set for 04/20/22 at 3pm will remain for all cases.

In 22CF44: Waives reading of the complaint and bond is set. 
In 22CF44 and 21CF1394: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waivers in both files. 
In  21CF184, 21CF600, 20CF1427, 20CF1572: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
In all files: A plea hearing is scheduled for 3-18-22 at 9:30 AM (in person). (No ARGN in 22CF44 or 21CF1394 yet).

Conditions:

No contact with A.S. or residence.
